intro: Galium divaricatum var. mungieri, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage and flowers are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported health benefits.
